official-title.#text:
To establish Presidential awards to recognize organizations that have made extraordinary efforts to
			 create jobs and strengthen the economy of the United States.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Presidential Make it in America Awards Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Presidential Make it in America Awards Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Presidential Make It In America Awards

text.#text: There are established the following Presidential awards:

The Presidential Reshoring Award, which shall be awarded to the best example of a United States
			 company that returns manufacturing jobs and operations from overseas to
			 the United States.

The Presidential Invest in America Award, which shall be awarded to the best example of a United
			 States company that invests in significant new domestic manufacturing jobs
			 and operations.

The Presidential Foreign Direct Investment Award, which shall be awarded to the best example of a
			 foreign company that invests in United States manufacturing jobs and
			 operations.

text.#text: The presentation of the awards shall be made by the
An organization may qualify for an award under this section only if it—
submits an application to the

permits a rigorous evaluation of the way in which its business and other operations have benefitted
			 the economic or social well-being of the United States; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines to be appropriate to achieve
			 the objectives of this section.

text.#text: The expansion, subdivision, modification, or establishment of award categories under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may be made to a qualified
			 organization in each eligible category. No award shall be made within any

text.#text: In any year, not more than 1 of each award described in

An organization to which an award is made under this section may publicize the receipt of the award
			 by the organization and may use the award in advertising.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall publish on the website of the

information on the
			 successful strategies and programs of organizations that receive awards
			 under this section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is authorized to seek and accept gifts from public and private sources to carry out
			 the program under this section. If additional sums are needed to cover the
			 full cost of the program, the

shall impose fees upon the
			 organizations applying for an award in amounts sufficient to provide such
			 additional sums. The

is authorized to use appropriated funds to
			 carry out responsibilities under this Act.

text.#text: The

and the

			 of the activities conducted under this section.
